com.foreach.imageserver.dto

Class ImageTransformDto

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.foreach.imageserver.dto.ImageTransformDto

  • public class ImageTransformDto
extends Object
    Represents a single transformation that can be done on an image. A transform can be written to and converted from a single line string which can easily be used in URLs. A transform string has the form of PARAM_VALUE,PARAM_VALUE

    The following parameters are supported:

    • scene: setScene(Integer)
    • w: setWidth(Integer)
    • h: setHeight(Integer)
    • ar: setAspectRatio(AspectRatio)
    • maxw: setMaxWidth(Integer)
    • maxh: setMaxHeight(Integer)
    • dpi: setDpi(Integer)
    • cx: set crop x coordinate
    • cy: set crop y coordinate
    • cw: set crop width
    • ch: set crop height
    • csw: set the assumed width of the source image for the crop coordinates
    • csh: set the assumed height of the source image for the crop coordinates
    • cbw: set the width of the box that contained the source image for the crop coordinates
    • cbh: set the height of the box that contained the source image for the crop coordinates
    • color: setColorSpace(ColorSpaceDto)
    • bg: setBackgroundColor(ColorDto)
    • alpha: setAlphaColor(ColorDto)
    • q: setQuality(Integer)
    • o: output type of the transform result, extension of supported ImageTypeDto, see setOutputType(ImageTypeDto)
    Since:
    5.0.0
    Author:
    Arne Vandamme

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

      • builder

        public static ImageTransformDto.ImageTransformDtoBuilder builder()

      • toBuilder

        public ImageTransformDto.ImageTransformDtoBuilder toBuilder()

      • getScene

        public Integer getScene()
        The specific scene of the source image that should be transformed. Only relevant for multi-scene formats like PDF where a scene corresponds to a page in the PDF. If not specified, the output type will determine if either the entire original image or a specific scene will be used. 0-based.

      • getWidth

        public Integer getWidth()
        The width in pixels of the resulting image. If both width and height are not specified, the original image width will be assumed. If height is specified but width is not, a width will be calculated according to the aspect ratio of the original image. Any value smaller than 1 will behave as if width is not specified.

      • getHeight

        public Integer getHeight()
        The height in pixels of the resulting image. If both width and height are not specified, the original image height will be assumed. If width is specified but height is not, a height will be calculated according to the aspect ratio of the original image. Any value smaller than 1 will behave as if height is not specified.

      • getMaxWidth

        public Integer getMaxWidth()
        Maximum width of the resulting image. Regardless of width, the resulting image will be downscaled to fit in the boundaries box defined by maximum width and height (when specified). Can be used to scale an image to fit inside this box without having to specify width or height.

      • getMaxHeight

        public Integer getMaxHeight()
        Maximum height of the resulting image. Regardless of height, the resulting image will be downscaled to fit in the boundaries box defined by maximum width and height (when specified). Can be used to scale an image to fit inside this box without having to specify width or height.

      • getAspectRatio

        public AspectRatio getAspectRatio()
        The aspect ratio that the resulting image should have. If both width and height are specified, this parameter will be ignored. If either width or height is specified, the aspect ratio will be used to calculate the other dimension accordingly. If neither width and height is specified, the actual width and height will be calculated by looking at the original image dimensions and using them to get the largest possible values matching the requested aspect ratio.

      • getDpi

        public Integer getDpi()
        DPI that should be used for processing the image (and in the resulting output image). A higher DPI will result in larger output files but with much more detail. Equivalent of ImageModificationDto.getDensity() which will most likely be deprecated in the future.

      • getCrop

        public CropDto getCrop()
        Contains the settings for the crop that should be taken from the original image. If not specified, no cropping will be applied and the entire original image will be used as the base.

      • getQuality

        public Integer getQuality()
        Quality for the created image, relevant for lossy image formats like JPEG. Should be percentage represented as a value between 1 and 100. If not specified, the default quality configured on the application will be used.

      • getBackgroundColor

        public ColorDto getBackgroundColor()
        Color specification for the background of the image. Any alpha channel will be changed to this color. If you want to replace an existing color instead, you can combine with setAlphaColor(ColorDto).

      • getAlphaColor

        public ColorDto getAlphaColor()
        Color specification of a color that should be made transparent. Only hex value without the leading # is supported.

      • getColorSpace

        public ColorSpaceDto getColorSpace()
        Color space for the resulting image, can for example be used to convert to grayscale.

      • getOutputType

        public ImageTypeDto getOutputType()
        The output type for this transform.

      • setScene

        public void setScene(Integer scene)
        The specific scene of the source image that should be transformed. Only relevant for multi-scene formats like PDF where a scene corresponds to a page in the PDF. If not specified, the output type will determine if either the entire original image or a specific scene will be used. 0-based.

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(Integer width)
        The width in pixels of the resulting image. If both width and height are not specified, the original image width will be assumed. If height is specified but width is not, a width will be calculated according to the aspect ratio of the original image. Any value smaller than 1 will behave as if width is not specified.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(Integer height)
        The height in pixels of the resulting image. If both width and height are not specified, the original image height will be assumed. If width is specified but height is not, a height will be calculated according to the aspect ratio of the original image. Any value smaller than 1 will behave as if height is not specified.

      • setAspectRatio

        public void setAspectRatio(AspectRatio aspectRatio)

If either width or height is specified, the aspect ratio will be used to calculate the other dimension accordingly. If neither width and height is specified, the actual width and height will be calculated by looking at the original image dimensions and using them to get the largest possible values matching the requested aspect ratio.
